com.st.BlueSTSDK.Features

Class FeatureAudioADPCMSync

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.BlueSTSDK.Feature
      • com.st.BlueSTSDK.Features.FeatureAudioADPCMSync

  • public class FeatureAudioADPCMSync
extends Feature
    Feature that contains the audio synchronization parameters necessary to ADPCM audio decompression
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    STMicroelectronics - Central Labs.

    • Method Detail

      • extractData

        protected Feature.ExtractResult extractData(long timestamp,
                                            byte[] data,
                                            int dataOffset)
        extract the audio sync data from the node raw data, in this case it read a short adpcm_index_in and an int adpcm_predsample_in values which represent the synchronization parameters.
        Specified by:
        extractData in class Feature
        Parameters:
        data - array where read the Field data (a 6 bytes array)
        dataOffset - offset where start to read the data (0 by default)
        timestamp - data timestamp
        Returns:
        number of read bytes (6) and data extracted (the audio sync params, a short and an int)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the data array has not enough data

      • getPredictedSample

        public static int getPredictedSample(Feature.Sample s)

      • getIndex

        public static short getIndex(Feature.Sample s)

      • notifyUpdate

        protected void notifyUpdate(Feature.Sample sample)
        Description copied from class: Feature
        call the method Feature.FeatureListener.onUpdate(Feature, Feature.Sample) for each listener that subscribe to this feature.

        each call will be run in a different thread

        If you extend the method overwrite the method Feature.update_priv(long, byte[], int) you have to call this method for notify to the user the new sample

        Overrides:
        notifyUpdate in class Feature
        Parameters:
        sample - new data that we have to notify to the listener
